title: How to Make Banana Nut Muffins

steps.headline: Prepare the muffin tins.
steps.description: Spray a light layer of non-stick cooking spray in each tin.

steps.headline: Get a large bowl.
steps.description: Combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.

steps.headline: Beat the egg whites together, just a bit, in a medium bowl.
Add and mix the sugar, mashed bananas, vegetable oil, and lemon zest into the egg whites.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients.
Fold the walnuts into the mixture.
Scoop and add the mixture to the muffin tins, about 2/3 full.
Bake the muffins for at least 20-25 minutes.
Cool the muffins on cooling racks.

text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/175ºC.  Prepare the muffin tins. Spray a light layer of non-stick cooking spray in each tin. Get a large bowl. Combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Beat the egg whites together, just a bit, in a medium bowl.  Add and mix the sugar, mashed bananas, vegetable oil, and lemon zest into the egg whites.  Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients.  Combine everything together. Avoid over-mixing the batter. Fold the walnuts into the mixture.  Scoop and add the mixture to the muffin tins, about 2/3 full.  Bake the muffins for at least 20-25 minutes.  Cool the muffins on cooling racks.  Finished.
